intro: Erigeron acris subsp. droebachensis, commonly known as the Droebachense Fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender stems and narrow, gray-green leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers bloom in summer, producing a showy display of white or pale yellow petals.
